communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records containing the phrase “Atlanta Community Press Collective” sent or received between February 1, 2024, and May 16, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A .csv printout of metadata showing communications (emails, calendar invites, tasks) sent or received by Bob Taylor - btaylor@uga.edu - through the Microsoft suite of products between Tuesday, May 13, 2024, at 10:00 pm eastern, and Friday, May 17, 2024, at 8:49 a.m. eastern, pertaining to the Open Records Request assigned tracking number “24-235”. Please include the following metadata: Sender, Recipient, CC, BCC, Subject, Date Sent, Date Received, Attachments, Message Size. 

Responsive records would include, at minimum, a tasking or assignment email to records custodian(s) to search for these records, a description of the request, and notifications to stakeholders regarding the receipt of the request. 

Thank you very much, 

Andrew Free

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free
